{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is about Neisseria gonorrhoea. The statement is that 'all are true except'. So, we need to check each option and find the one that is not supported by evidence. Option A is correct as N. gonorrhoea is a common cause of urethritis in males. Option B is also correct as all stains of N. gonorrhoea are susceptible to penicillin. Option C is correct as disseminated gonococcal infection can be caused by axoregnic strains of N. gonorrhoeae. Option D is incorrect as N. gonorrhoeae can infect other primates besides humans, making it a zoonotic pathogen.", "answer_choice": "D"}
